titlestmt.titleproper: Thomas H., Jr., and Alice Sherborne collection 1929-1956 1945-1950
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Thomas H., Jr., and Alice Sherborne collection
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Thomas Henry Sherborne, Jr. was born in Philadelphia in 1898, and later lived in Elmhurst, New York. He married Alice Hamer, who was born in Omaha in 1909. They were married in 1943.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of of genealogical research materials, which include: printed materials; notes; certificates of membership from various genealogical societies; vital records such as birth and marriage certificates (originals and some copies); and surname lists. There are also some (blank) postcards of historic sites, several World War II ration books, and notes, clippings, and printed materials on non-genealogical topics, including English rulers, history, and literature, science, and art.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: New England Historic Genealogical Society: Thomas Henry Sherborne papers (Mss 252).
